body: Would it be possible to implement a way to see both upvotes as well as the amount of downvotes for posts and comments? I think that when Reddit took this away, that kind of heralded the beginning of the end, as it was a loss in transparency.
body_html: Would it be possible to implement a way to see both upvotes as well as the amount of downvotes for posts and comments? I think that when Reddit took this away, that kind of heralded the beginning of the end, as it was a loss in transparency.

body: That would be a nice feature

body:
I'm a bit ambivalent about this one, because I prefer it over the current arrangement but I'd like it even more if numbers weren't shown. People tend to vote in herds and be strongly prejudiced by the number shown before they vote. Maybe show it afterwards?

In the meantime, remember you can sort by disputed ("controversial" in Reddit lingo).
body_html:
I'm a bit ambivalent about this one, because I prefer it over the current arrangement but I'd like it even more if numbers weren't shown. People tend to vote in herds and be strongly prejudiced by the number shown before they vote. Maybe show it afterwards?

In the meantime, remember you can sort by disputed ("controversial" in Reddit lingo).

post.body: Would it be possible to implement a way to see both upvotes as well as the amount of downvotes for posts and comments? I think that when Reddit took this away, that kind of heralded the beginning of the end, as it was a loss in transparency.
post.body_html: Would it be possible to implement a way to see both upvotes as well as the amount of downvotes for posts and comments? I think that when Reddit took this away, that kind of heralded the beginning of the end, as it was a loss in transparency.
post.title: Transparency with Votes

body:
That's an interesting take, how would rank what goes on the front page though? I, personally,  think hidden scores do more to help vote manipulation behind the scenes, but maybe I shouldn't be so paranoid with the "new" admin culture of Ruqqus. 

I love Disputed (used to love Controversial, did you know they took out the option to sort by Controversial on Reddit's Front Page?) and New, but I also want to be able to sort by most votes, downvotes and/or upvotes, that way I can be able to see the most downvoted as well as the most upvoted items, so I know which comments/posts had the most engagement. It's kind of like Disputed meets Top, if that makes sense.
body_html:
That's an interesting take, how would rank what goes on the front page though? I, personally, think hidden scores do more to help vote manipulation behind the scenes, but maybe I shouldn't be so paranoid with the "new" admin culture of Ruqqus.

I love Disputed (used to love Controversial, did you know they took out the option to sort by Controversial on Reddit's Front Page?) and New, but I also want to be able to sort by most votes, downvotes and/or upvotes, that way I can be able to see the most downvoted as well as the most upvoted items, so I know which comments/posts had the most engagement. It's kind of like Disputed meets Top, if that makes sense.

body: I'll throw a spanner in the works here because Ruqqus lets me. I personally would prefer no points. Just give a percentage of people who agreed/disagreed but no points to anyone. This way, no one goes crazy trying to farm precious internet points, points that can be redeemed for interest from women I hear.

body: They could still keep the scores so the ranking would be unaffected, just hide the scores. Frankly I hate the group assigning value to comments. All it leads to is people looking to post whatever gets them a lot of upvotes.

body: Isn't it interesting to see how many people seem to want this site to be a duplicate of Reddit while thinking the ultimate result will be different? The "karma"/"rep" system is a big problem. It enforces groupthink, akin to voting for high school prom king and queen, and invites karma whoring and brigading. And now people want the same thing here?
body_html: Isn't it interesting to see how many people seem to want this site to be a duplicate of Reddit while thinking the ultimate result will be different? The "karma"/"rep" system is a big problem. It enforces groupthink, akin to voting for high school prom king and queen, and invites karma whoring and brigading. And now people want the same thing here?

The "karma"/"rep" system is a big problem. It enforces groupthink, akin to voting for high school prom king and queen, and invites karma whoring and brigading. And now people want the same thing here?
parent.body_html: Isn't it interesting to see how many people seem to want this site to be a duplicate of Reddit while thinking the ultimate result will be different? The "karma"/"rep" system is a big problem. It enforces groupthink, akin to voting for high school prom king and queen, and invites karma whoring and brigading. And now people want the same thing here?

post.body: Would it be possible to implement a way to see both upvotes as well as the amount of downvotes for posts and comments? I think that when Reddit took this away, that kind of heralded the beginning of the end, as it was a loss in transparency.
post.body_html: Would it be possible to implement a way to see both upvotes as well as the amount of downvotes for posts and comments? I think that when Reddit took this away, that kind of heralded the beginning of the end, as it was a loss in transparency.
post.title: Transparency with Votes

author.bio:
Oliver from Savannah, Georgia, USA.

How I Ruqqus : 
I use news aggregators like popurls.com and upstract.com. Google news with many and large publishers filtered. I save interesting things to the bookmark manager 'raindrop' to share with y'all!

Oliver from Savannah, Georgia, USA.

How I Ruqqus : I use news aggregators like popurls.com and upstract.com. Google news with many and large publishers filtered. I save interesting things to the bookmark manager 'raindrop' to share with y'all!

body:
Mods need to be accountable too

Extrapolating: What's to stop an admin from becoming an anonymous mod and banning groupthink ?

I can't think of a solution that is within the current framework.

body:
I kind of agree, in that maybe after 1000+ rep, Ruqqus could stop showing it, so people just post to enrich the guild they're part of. I will say, however, I *do* want what Reddit used to be, a place I could go on to instantly see the newest memes, what's going on in the news (not just for the US) and interesting things I can mention to friends, when the time arises (instead of the weird factoid culture where things that sound good are taken as instantly true). 

It's kind of like League of Legends for me. I *HATE* what it's become, not only gameplay wise (they reworked all my favourite champs :( ) but also art wise, and the whole demographic they're  targeting - it feels very, and excuse the language here but, yellow feverish. It became a culturally Asian dominated mass, that I had to leave in season 6. All that to say, if LoL came out with a legacy server that was itself in its golden years, season 3 (fight me s5 scrubs) I would go back to it in a heartbeat. Because I liked what it used to be, not what it became, same for Reddit.
body_html:
I kind of agree, in that maybe after 1000+ rep, Ruqqus could stop showing it, so people just post to enrich the guild they're part of. I will say, however, I do want what Reddit used to be, a place I could go on to instantly see the newest memes, what's going on in the news (not just for the US) and interesting things I can mention to friends, when the time arises (instead of the weird factoid culture where things that sound good are taken as instantly true).

It's kind of like League of Legends for me. I HATE what it's become, not only gameplay wise (they reworked all my favourite champs :( ) but also art wise, and the whole demographic they're targeting - it feels very, and excuse the language here but, yellow feverish. It became a culturally Asian dominated mass, that I had to leave in season 6. All that to say, if LoL came out with a legacy server that was itself in its golden years, season 3 (fight me s5 scrubs) I would go back to it in a heartbeat. Because I liked what it used to be, not what it became, same for Reddit.

parent.body: I'll throw a spanner in the works here because Ruqqus lets me. I personally would prefer no points. Just give a percentage of people who agreed/disagreed but no points to anyone. This way, no one goes crazy trying to farm precious internet points, points that can be redeemed for interest from women I hear.

body: You seem to equate popularity with quality. I don't. The prom queen in our high school was a really nice and very intelligent girl, and I liked her. We were friends from elementary school forward, and shared a few laughs about the prom voting. The prom king, on the other hand, was (naturally) the best looking guy in the class, but also a complete asshole and none too smart. In any case, I think the "sort" you want amounts to an adult popularity contest and nothing more. By the way, if this site limited up and down scores to 5 in each direction, it will still permit rankings without unduly reinforcing the gamesmanship I've been warning about.
body_html: You seem to equate popularity with quality. I don't. The prom queen in our high school was a really nice and very intelligent girl, and I liked her. We were friends from elementary school forward, and shared a few laughs about the prom voting. The prom king, on the other hand, was (naturally) the best looking guy in the class, but also a complete asshole and none too smart. In any case, I think the "sort" you want amounts to an adult popularity contest and nothing more. By the way, if this site limited up and down scores to 5 in each direction, it will still permit rankings without unduly reinforcing the gamesmanship I've been warning about.

post.body_html: Would it be possible to implement a way to see both upvotes as well as the amount of downvotes for posts and comments? I think that when Reddit took this away, that kind of heralded the beginning of the end, as it was a loss in transparency.
post.title: Transparency with Votes

body:
I am unfamiliar with "League of Legends," which means I could easily be wrong in guessing that it involves online video gaming. I've never been interested in it, and was rarely much of a video gamer after "Sim City" and "Microsoft Golf." The vast majority of my involvement with video games was to kill time in this or that pickup bar. PacMan and Asteroids were good ways to pass the time, along with pinball machines and pool tables. I don't disparage video games -- really, each to their own, and I mean it. I only mention this by way of saying that I'm entirely clueless when it comes to multiplayer online video games. 

Ask yourself what screwed up Reddit. It wouldn't be just one thing, but the more thought I've given to it the more I think that the "karma" system is pernicious for all the reasons I've been stating in comments and posts. By the way, one of my other suggestions has been to include an account setting that would allow any user to make new material the default setting rather than the current Reddit-clone popularity ranking that's now the default.
body_html:
I am unfamiliar with "League of Legends," which means I could easily be wrong in guessing that it involves online video gaming. I've never been interested in it, and was rarely much of a video gamer after "Sim City" and "Microsoft Golf." The vast majority of my involvement with video games was to kill time in this or that pickup bar. PacMan and Asteroids were good ways to pass the time, along with pinball machines and pool tables. I don't disparage video games -- really, each to their own, and I mean it. I only mention this by way of saying that I'm entirely clueless when it comes to multiplayer online video games.

Ask yourself what screwed up Reddit. It wouldn't be just one thing, but the more thought I've given to it the more I think that the "karma" system is pernicious for all the reasons I've been stating in comments and posts. By the way, one of my other suggestions has been to include an account setting that would allow any user to make new material the default setting rather than the current Reddit-clone popularity ranking that's now the default.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

parent.body:
I kind of agree, in that maybe after 1000+ rep, Ruqqus could stop showing it, so people just post to enrich the guild they're part of. I will say, however, I *do* want what Reddit used to be, a place I could go on to instantly see the newest memes, what's going on in the news (not just for the US) and interesting things I can mention to friends, when the time arises (instead of the weird factoid culture where things that sound good are taken as instantly true). 

It's kind of like League of Legends for me. I *HATE* what it's become, not only gameplay wise (they reworked all my favourite champs :( ) but also art wise, and the whole demographic they're  targeting - it feels very, and excuse the language here but, yellow feverish. It became a culturally Asian dominated mass, that I had to leave in season 6. All that to say, if LoL came out with a legacy server that was itself in its golden years, season 3 (fight me s5 scrubs) I would go back to it in a heartbeat. Because I liked what it used to be, not what it became, same for Reddit.

All that to say, if LoL came out with a legacy server that was itself in its golden years, season 3 (fight me s5 scrubs) I would go back to it in a heartbeat. author.bio: How many time do I have before getting cancelled ?
author.bio_html: How many time do I have before getting cancelled ?

body:
First of all, I talked about a sorting system, not a popularity contest. What I meant was creating a sorting system that will sort good content. You can't deny the fact that sporting make things easier, more enjoyable, and time saving. That's why I proposed to extend the binary upvote/downvote system to a complementary like/dislike system. Your example is off-topic.

Also, I don't equate popularity with quality. But you also can't deny that the group popularity effect IS an indicator of how much the popular thing require your attention. You can find example all over in nature and human behaviour. (vultures search tactic, to name one).
body_html:
First of all, I talked about a sorting system, not a popularity contest. What I meant was creating a sorting system that will sort good content. You can't deny the fact that sporting make things easier, more enjoyable, and time saving. That's why I proposed to extend the binary upvote/downvote system to a complementary like/dislike system. Your example is off-topic.

Also, I don't equate popularity with quality. But you also can't deny that the group popularity effect IS an indicator of how much the popular thing require your attention. You can find example all over in nature and human behaviour. (vultures search tactic, to name one).

parent.body: You seem to equate popularity with quality. I don't. The prom queen in our high school was a really nice and very intelligent girl, and I liked her. We were friends from elementary school forward, and shared a few laughs about the prom voting. The prom king, on the other hand, was (naturally) the best looking guy in the class, but also a complete asshole and none too smart. In any case, I think the "sort" you want amounts to an adult popularity contest and nothing more. By the way, if this site limited up and down scores to 5 in each direction, it will still permit rankings without unduly reinforcing the gamesmanship I've been warning about.
